SEARCH
Package com.example.lottary.ui.browse

Class FilterOptions

java.lang.Object
com.example.lottary.ui.browse.FilterOptions
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.os.Parcelable
public class FilterOptions extends Object implements android.os.Parcelable
FilterOptions Purpose / Role: - A simple, parcelable container that holds all filter criteria used by the Browse screen. - Passed between the Filter bottom sheet and the Browse list fragment to keep UI in sync. Invariants: - types never null; getters return a defensive copy to avoid external mutation. Time Semantics: - fromDateMs / toDateMs are UNIX epoch times in milliseconds. A value of 0 means "unset" (no bound). Mutability: - Fluent setters return this so callers can chain multiple calls. Parcelable: - Booleans are marshalled as bytes. - types are written as a list of strings.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • writeToParcel

      public void writeToParcel(@NonNull android.os.Parcel dest, int flags)
      Marshal the object into a Parcel. The read order must mirror the write order. Booleans are written as bytes (1/0). Types are serialized as a list of strings.
      Specified by:
      writeToParcel in interface android.os.Parcelable
